The risk of flooding from the watercourses around the River Rase and Upper Ancholme has now reduced and levels have fallen below those of concern. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Bain, River Waring, Haltham Beck, Scrivelsby

items.message: The risk of flooding from the watercourses around the Bain Catchment has now reduced and levels have fallen below levels of concern. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

Following heavy rainfall yesterday, the water level in the Eastern Yar at Alverstone is now slowly falling. At Sandown the level has just peaked, and will begin to fall later on this morning (18/8/22). Today, thunderstorms are no longer forecast, although lighter showers could bring small amounts of rain (up to 10mm). If any showers should impact the river, whilst the water level will rise a little, it will remain in bank. From tomorrow onwards (19/8/22) the weather is drier and settled and the water level in the river will return to normal.
